articles.title: HILL: Albertans will pay for Smith government’s red ink
articles.description: For decades, successive Alberta governments have failed to restrain spending during periods of relatively strong resource revenues. Instead, as money flows in, governments fall into the temptation to spend even more, which only leads to trouble when resource revenues inevitably decline.

articles.title: Single enzyme mutation reveals a hidden trigger in dementia
articles.description: Researchers discovered that a tiny structural feature of the enzyme GPX4 helps keep neurons safe. A rare mutation removes this protection, allowing harmful molecules to damage cell membranes and trigger early dementia. Mouse and cell studies showed changes resembling Alzheimer’s. articles.title: Stunning blue pigment on a 13,000-year-old artifact surprises scientists
articles.description: Researchers uncovered rare azurite traces on a Final Paleolithic artifact, overturning assumptions that early Europeans used only red and black pigments.
